From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2024 Indian science fiction film


Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha JiyaTheatrical release posterDirected byAmit JoshiAradhana SahWritten byAmit JoshiAradhana SahProduced byDinesh VijanJyoti DeshpandeLaxman UtekarStarring
Shahid Kapoor
Kriti Sanon
CinematographyLaxman UtekarEdited byManish PradhanMusic byScore:Sachin–JigarSongs:Tanishk BagchiSachin–JigarMitrazRaghavTalwiinderNDSMC SQUAREProductioncompanies
Maddock Films
Jio Studios
Distributed byPen Marudhar EntertainmentRelease date
9 February 2024 (2024-02-09)
Running time143 minutes[1]CountryIndiaLanguageHindiBudget₹75 crore[2][3]Box office₹133.64 crore[4]
Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya (transl. Got so entangled in your words) is a 2024 Indian Hindi-language science fiction romantic comedy starring Shahid Kapoor and Kriti Sanon. The film is written and directed by Amit Joshi and Aradhana Sah, in their directorial debuts, and produced by Maddock Films and Jio Studios.[5]
Principal photography commenced in October 2022 and ended in April 2023. The film was released theatrically on 9 February 2024 to mixed-to-positive reviews from critics.[6] It became the seventh-highest-grossing Indian film of 2024.


Plot[edit]
Aryan Agnihotri is a Delhi-born smart robotics engineer based out of Mumbai, taking after his aunt, Urmila Shukla, who has a company of her own, E-Robotics, in California. She invites him to America, where he eventually meets the Super Intelligent Female Robot Automation alias SIFRA, Urmila's secretary, who looks and behaves like a human, a fact unknown to him. He falls in love with her but later learns that she is actually a robot and ploy used by his aunt to test if humans could tell SIFRA apart from themselves.
Heartbroken, he returns to India and agrees to an arranged marriage. However, when he realizes his love for SIFRA, he decides to sneak out of the engagement ceremony and is caught by his grandfather, who suggests him to follow his heart and assures him that he will handle the family in his absence. Aryan wishes for SIFRA to be in India so that he could introduce her to his family; he calls up his aunt to ask her to send her to India for further "testing" against a traditional Indian family. She agrees for it and sends her to India, where Aryan introduces her as his girlfriend to his family leading to numerous comical situations.
Aryan's family, unaware that she is a robot, agree to their marriage. Before their wedding, she installs a faulty update ridden with a virus which corrupts her memory and causes her to forget everything. Aryan calls his aunt to ask for help, and she sends him a memory backup which Aryan installs, causing her to successfully recover her memory. Urmila, who was unaware of Aryan's intentions of marrying her, is against him after knowing the truth and orders him to return her as she is her company's IP. He manages to convince his aunt after an emotional conversation, who agrees to let him keep her.
On their wedding day, a blackout occurs while SIFRA is charging herself, which causes her to malfunction. Her speech becomes distorted and movements begin to glitch while she performs orders given to her previously that were taken back, one of them being "setting Delhi on fire". Looking at the destruction caused by her, a heartbroken Aryan is left with no choice but to stop her, ultimately by slashing her face with a sword, which reveals the inner technical workings of her, and realizes that even though she looks human, she can never truly be one.
Sometime later, Urmila launches a series of robots, including SIFRA 2.0. The new SIFRA has her memory and settings formatted and Aryan is no longer her admin. Jiah, a new intern, approaches Aryan and flirts with him. Looking at their bonding, the new SIFRA starts to feel jealous and Aryan notices her emotions, shocked of coming to the realization that she can have feelings of her own now.

Production[edit]
In August 2022, Shahid Kapoor and Kriti Sanon were signed to star in Dinesh Vijan's next robot rom-com.[8] Production began in October 2022 and ended in April 2023.[9] The film's title Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya was revealed in January 2024.[10]

Soundtrack[edit]
Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha JiyaSoundtrack album by Tanishk Bagchi, Sachin–Jigar, Raghav, Mitraz, Talwiinder, MC Square and NDSReleased5 February 2024GenreFeature film soundtrackLength16:26LanguageHindiLabelT-SeriesOfficial audioTeri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya (Full Album on YouTube

The music of Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya is composed by Tanishk Bagchi, Sachin–Jigar, Raghav, Mitraz, Talwiinder, MC Square and NDS. The first single titled "Laal Peeli Akhiyaan", an adaptation of a Rajasthani song of the same name, was released on 12 January 2024.[11] The second single, a remake of "Gulaab" by Mitraz, "Akhiyaan Gulaab" was released on 24 January 2024.[12]
The song "Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya (Title Track)" was a remake of the song "Teri Baaton (Your Words)" from the 2004 album Storyteller by the Canadian singer Raghav.[13][14] The fourth single titled "Tum Se" was released on 2 February 2024.[15] The fifth single, a remake of "Gallan 4" by Talwiinder called "Gallan" released on 13 February 2024.[16]

Release[edit]
Theatrical[edit]
Initially scheduled for release on 7 December 2023, Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya was finally released on 9 February 2024, coinciding with the Valentine's Day weekend.[17][18]

Home media[edit]
The film was premiered on Amazon Prime Video from 5 April 2024.[19]

Sequel[edit]
In the ending of the movie when SIFRA (Sanon) starts to feel jealous and Aryan notices her emotions it was clearly shown that a sequel will be coming soon.

Reception[edit]
Critical response[edit]
Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya received mixed-to-positive reviews from critics.[20] On the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, 43% of 14 critics' reviews are positive, with an average rating of 5.4/10.[21]
Anupama Chopra, in her review for Film Companion said that "Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya is a good-looking film with foreign locations, beach and shaadi songs, stylish clothes and expansive houses and offices. The surfaces are gleaming. I wish the writing had matched".[22] In a similar take, NDTV's Saibal Chatterjee rated the film 1.5/5 and opined "Once the novelty of the notion wears off - and that happens pretty quickly - there is little on offer here barring the fact that this is the first time that Shahid Kapoor and Kriti Sanon have teamed up".[23]
Anuj Kumar of The Hindu had a more lukewarm response to the film, reviewing "Shahid Kapoor and Kriti Sanon submit themselves to a fantastic idea that doesn't quite reach its potential, but provides moments of harmless fun as it probes the state of affairs in modern-day romance".[24] News18's Titas Chowdhury rated the film 3/5 and praised Kapoor and Sanon's "scintillating chemistry".[25]
A critic from Bollywood Hungama gave 2.5 out of 5 stars and wrote "Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya rests on the fine performances but suffers due to the writing and an abrupt climax."[26] The Indian Express's Shubhra Gupta rated the film 2 out of 5 stars and stated "Shahid Kapoor and Kriti Sanon deliver confused film that combines sci-fi tropes with mushy Indian family drama".[27]

Box office[edit]
The film grossed ₹96.29 crore (US$12 million) in India and ₹37.35 crore (US$4.7 million) overseas, for a worldwide total of ₹133.64 crore (US$17 million).[28]
